title: Legoland has tickets from £36 including both its Halloween and fireworks events
text:

Legoland Windsor is giving parents the chance to plan a fun-filled day out for the kids this October half term , without breaking the bank.

The theme park currently has day tickets from £36pp - and that includes both its spooky Halloween events as well as its dazzling fireworks show.

In fact, if you book a ticket on one of the days featuring the fireworks show, you'll get entry to the park, access to the Brick or Treat activities, and the dazzling display too!

The best part is that there are still tickets up for grabs - but you'll need to book Legoland tickets online to bag the cheap rates.

The fireworks show will be available for six nights; the 19th, 20th, 25th and 26th October, as well as the 1st and 2nd of November.

It's going to be a pretty spectacular display (for a start, the pyrotechnics are created by the same company who put on London's NYE display), with heaps of colours, effects and if you opt for 3D glasses a special finish where the fireworks burst into thousands of LEGO bricks.

(Image: PA)

Following the show, there will even be the chance to enjoy some of the attractions after dusk!

The good news is that as the fireworks kick off at 7pm, you'll have ample opportunity to enjoy a whole day at the park with its 55 attractions and rides.

Oh, and as it's Halloween season, you can also expect extra spooky surprises thanks to the park's Brick or Treat event.

We're talking a Monster Rocker’s Dance Party, daily fancy dress competitions, a ghost hunt across the park, and new features such giant LEGO Minifigure pumpkin heads and a Creepy Cobweb takeover of the Castle complete with supersize LEGO spiders.

If you don't live within driving distance of the park, or you're after a mini break with the kids, you can book overnight stays at the resort, including the LEGOLAND Castle Hotel and LEGOLAND Resort Hotel .

For example, the LEGOLAND hotel has themed family rooms from £94pp, while the Castle Hotel has themed family rooms available from £136pp until the 2nd November. (This includes breakfast, park tickets for two days and early access to select rides in the resort).

On a budget?

You can find packages at Legoland partner hotels from £47pp which include breakfast as well as park tickets for two days.

You can find out more and book your stays on the Legoland website .
description: Legoland Windsor is set to host an epic fireworks display alongside its Halloween event - and you can bag cheap tickets
